exceptions.tactic: apply sup_clos_min with (T := T) (s := s) (t := t).
exceptions.exn: In environment T : cpo s : Pred T t : Pred_Class Hleq : s <=p t Hclosed : [Pred s | bot \\In s /\\ (forall d : chain T, d <=p s -> lim d \\In s)] t The term "T" has type "cpo" while it is expected to have type "lattice".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: cpo
s: Pred T
t: Pred_Class

Goal:
s <=p t -> chain_closed t -> chain_closure s <=p t

Premises:
chain_closure = fun s : Pred T => [Pred p | forall t : Pred T, s <=p t -> chain_closed t -> p \In t] : Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T
chain_closed = [Pred s | bot \In s /\ (forall d : chain T, d <=p s -> lim d \In s)] : Simpl_Pred (Pred T)
Pred = fun T : Type => T -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Pred _%type_scope
sup_clos_min : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) (t : Pred_Class), s <=p t -> sup_closed t -> sup_closure s <=p t
chain_clos_sub : forall s : Pred T, s <=p chain_closure s
sup_closure = fun (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) => [Pred p | forall t : Pred T, s <=p t -> t \In sup_closed -> p \In t] : forall T : lattice, Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T Arguments sup_closure {T}
Mem_map_inv : ?x \In [seq ?f i | i <- ?s] -> exists y : ?T, ?x = ?f y /\ y \In ?s where ?T : [T : cpo s : Pred T t : Pred_Class |- Type] ?T' : [T : cpo s : Pred T t : Pred_Class |- Type] ?f : [T : cpo s : Pred T t : Pred_Class |- ?T -> ?T'] ?x : [T : cpo s : Pred T t : Pred_Class |- ?T'] ?s : [T : cpo s : Pred T t : Pred_Class |- seq ?T]
CPO.sort = fun t : cpo => let (sort, _, _) := t in sort : cpo -> Type CPO.sort is a coercion
subp_trans : forall (T : Type) (p2 p1 p3 : Pred T), p1 <=p p2 -> p2 <=p p3 -> p1 <=p p3
Lattice.sort = fun t : lattice => let (sort, _, _) := t in sort : lattice -> Type Lattice.sort is a coercion
Poset.sort = fun t : poset => let (sort, _, _) := t in sort : poset -> Type Poset.sort is a coercion
sup_clos_sub : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T), s <=p sup_closure s
subp_asym : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 : Pred T), p1 <=p p2 -> p2 <=p p1 -> p1 =p p2
sup_clos_mono : forall (T : lattice) (s1 s2 : Pred T), s1 <=p s2 -> sup_closure s1 <=p sup_closure s2
subp_orr : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 q : Pred T), p1 <=p p2 -> PredU q p1 <=p PredU q p2
subp_orl : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 q : Pred T), p1 <=p p2 -> PredU p1 q <=p PredU p2 q
sup_closed = fun T : lattice => [Pred s | forall d : Pred_Class, d <=p s -> sup d \In s] : forall T : lattice, Simpl_Pred (Pred T) Arguments sup_closed {T}
Image_inj_sub : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (X1 X2 : Pred A), injective f -> [Image f i | i <- X1] <=p [Image f i | i <- X2] -> X1 <=p X2
subp_or : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 q : Pred T), p1 <=p q /\ p2 <=p q < -> PredU p1 p2 <=p q
sub_sup : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T), sup_closed s -> Pred (subPoset s) -> subPoset s
sup_mono : forall (T : lattice) (s1 s2 : Pred T), s1 <=p s2 -> sup s1 <== sup s2
subp_and : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 q : Pred T), q <=p p1 /\ q <=p p2 < -> q <=p (fun x : T => p1 x /\ p2 x)
subp_andr : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 q : Pred T), p1 <=p p2 -> (fun x : T => q x /\ p1 x) <=p (fun x : T => q x /\ p2 x)
subp_andl : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 q : Pred T), p1 <=p p2 -> (fun x : T => p1 x /\ q x) <=p (fun x : T => p2 x /\ q x)
sup_clos_idemp : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T), sup_closed s -> sup_closure s =p s
LatticeMixin : forall (T : poset) (mx_sup : Pred T -> T), (forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== mx_sup s) -> (forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> mx_sup s <== x) -> Lattice.mixin_of T
fun_supP : forall (A : Type) (B : lattice) (s : Pred (A -> B)) (p : A -> B), p \In s -> p <== fun_sup s
fun_supM : forall (A : Type) (B : lattice) (s : Pred (A -> B)) (p : A -> B), (forall q : A -> B, q \In s -> q <== p) -> fun_sup s <== p
prop_supP : forall (s : Pred Prop) (p : Prop), p \In s -> p <== prop_sup s
prop_supM : forall (s : Pred Prop) (p : propPoset), (forall q : Prop, q \In s -> q <== p) -> prop_sup s <== p
dfunCPO : forall A : Type, (A -> cpo) -> cpo
pairCPO = fun A B : cpo => CPO.Pack {| CPO.base := {| Poset.mixin := pairPosetMixin A B |}; CPO.mixin := pairCPOMixin A B |} (A * B) : cpo -> cpo -> cpo
prop_sup = fun s : Pred Prop => exists p : Prop, p \In s /\ p : Pred Prop -> Prop

```coq
unfold chain_closure.
unfold chain_closed.
intros Hleq Hclosed.
apply sup_clos_min with (T := T) (s := s) (t := t).
assumption.
assumption.
Qed.

original: unfold chain_closure. unfold chain_closed. intros Hleq Hclosed. apply sup_clos_min with (T := T) (s := s) (t := t). auto. auto.
